title: How to Bake Eggless Chocolate Chip Banana Muffins

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
steps.description: You'll be lowering the temperature to 400F as soon as the oven is preheated and you're about to put the muffins in. Doing this helps the muffins to rise.

steps.headline: Measure and combine your dry ingredients (the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt) in a large bowl.
Peel and mash your banana in a bowl (large enough to hold 2 cups).
Add to the mashed banana your milk and oil/butter.
Make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients.
Stir in your wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Make sure to stir well and get all the dry ingredients mixed in.

steps.headline: Add in the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Stir in the chocolate chips so they are throughout the whole mixture.

steps.headline: Line a muffin pan with muffin liners or silicone muffin liners (these work very nicely if you hate your muffin sticking to the paper liners).
Place the muffins on the bottom rack once the oven has preheated to 425F.
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden and cooked thoroughly.
Wait for your muffins to cool down and enjoy!

text: Preheat your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. You'll be lowering the temperature to 400F as soon as the oven is preheated and you're about to put the muffins in. Doing this helps the muffins to rise. Measure and combine your dry ingredients (the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt) in a large bowl.  Peel and mash your banana in a bowl (large enough to hold 2 cups).  Add to the mashed banana your milk and oil/butter. Stir it together. Make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients.  Stir in your wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Make sure to stir well and get all the dry ingredients mixed in. Add in the chocolate chips. Stir in the chocolate chips so they are throughout the whole mixture. Line a muffin pan with muffin liners or silicone muffin liners (these work very nicely if you hate your muffin sticking to the paper liners).  Place the muffins on the bottom rack once the oven has preheated to 425F.  Lower the temperature to 400F.  Bake for 25 minutes or until golden and cooked thoroughly.  Wait for your muffins to cool down and enjoy!
